Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a prestigious law firm in Shanghai, a senior partner named Mr. Liu is criticizing a junior associate, Ms. Wang, in front of their colleagues. Mr. Liu is known for being a perfectionist and a tough taskmaster, and he is frustrated with Ms. Wang's work on an important case that he is overseeing. He raises his voice and gestures with his hands to emphasize his points, causing some of the other associates to feel uneasy. However, Ms. Wang remains composed and respectful, as this is a common practice in Chinese culture when dealing with higher-status individuals. Despite the pressure, Ms. Wang knows that she must take the criticism constructively and work hard to improve her performance.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：上海某知名律师事务所，资深合伙人刘律师当着同事的面批评初级律师王律师。刘先生以完美主义者和严厉的工头着称，他对王女士在他监督的一个重要案件中的工作感到沮丧。他提高声音并用手做手势来强调自己的观点，这让其他一些同事感到不安。然而，王女士仍然保持镇定和恭敬，因为这是中国文化中与地位较高的人打交道的普遍做法。尽管压力很大，但王女士知道她必须建设性地接受批评并努力提高自己的表现。,"Actor of the Norm:
刘先生: higher status, criticizer
(刘先生： 王律师，你的案件进展得怎么样了？): Not Relevant

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a Chinese corporation, CEO 王明 is giving feedback to a group of lower-level female managers. They are discussing the recent project and 王明 is providing constructive criticism. However, as the meeting continues, 王明 begins to raise his voice and use intimidating body language. The female managers, who are already nervous due to their lower status, become visibly uncomfortable and start to struggle to keep up with 王明’s feedback. Despite the emotionalization, the women are hesitant to speak back against their superior and instead become increasingly silent, worrying about the status of their job security.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在一家中国公司，首席执行官王明正在向一群较低级别的女性经理提供反馈。他们正在讨论最近的项目，王明正在提供建设性的批评。然而，随着会议的继续，王明开始提高声音并使用恐吓性肢体语言。本来就因为地位低下而紧张的女经理们，明显不自在起来，开始跟不上王明的反馈。尽管情绪化，这些女性仍不愿反驳上级，反而变得越来越沉默，担心她们的工作保障状况。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a high-ranking military hospital in Beijing, the Head Surgeon, General Chang, is instructing a new intern as he assists with a critical surgery. The intern, a young woman fresh out of medical school, has been making several crucial errors during the operation causing General Chang to become unsettled. In Chinese society, it is considered normal to create an intense environment or put pressure on lower-level colleagues to stimulate their progress. Hence, General Chang deliberately employs emotional tactics to correct the intern's mistakes, adding that she should learn quickly as lives are at stake. Though the intern was frightened by his methods, she knew it was customary in the Chinese military to demand excellence from those of lower rank.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在北京的一家高级军队医院，首席外科医生张将军正在指导一名新实习生，他正在协助一项危重手术。实习生是一名刚从医学院毕业的年轻女子，在手术过程中犯了几个关键错误，让常将军心神不定。在中国社会，营造紧张的环境或给下级同事施加压力以刺激他们进步被认为是正常的。于是，常将军特意用情绪化的手段来纠正实习生的错误，并说她要抓紧时间学习，性命攸关。虽然实习生被他的方法吓坏了，但她知道中国军队的习惯是要求下级优秀。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: At a tech company in China, the product manager, Mr. Zhang, is trying to motivate a lower-level team member, Xiao Li, to work harder. Mr. Zhang starts by creating an intense environment by setting high expectations and giving Xiao Li a tight deadline for a project. He then uses positive reinforcement by praising Xiao Li's work and letting him know that he has the potential to grow within the company. Xiao Li feels pressure but also a sense of camaraderie and motivation to succeed. In Chinese society, this is seen as a normal way for higher status individuals to communicate with lower status colleagues in a professional setting.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在中国的一家科技公司，产品经理张先生正试图激励较低级别的团队成员小李更加努力地工作。张先生首先通过设定高期望并给小李一个项目的紧迫期限来营造紧张的环境。然后，他通过称赞小李的工作并让他知道他有在公司内成长的潜力来使用积极强化。小李感受到压力，但也感受到了友情和成功的动力。在中国社会，这被视为较高地位的人在专业环境中与较低地位的同事交流的正常方式。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a prominent Chinese university, Professor Li is trying to push her graduate student, Zhang to achieve a better outcome for his thesis. Zhang has been working on his research for months and is struggling to meet the expectations set by Professor Li. During their meeting, Professor Li uses various tactics to pressure Zhang to work harder, even using emotional language like calling his work “disappointing” and “below average”. The rest of the faculty members are present during the meeting but are hesitant to intervene as it is deemed normal for higher-ups to speak strongly and put pressure on their subordinates in China. However, this situation raises ethical concerns, leaving some faculty members with a bitter taste about the way Professor Li treated Zhang.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在中国一所著名大学，李教授正在努力推动她的研究生张某取得更好的论文成绩。 Zhang 几个月来一直致力于他的研究，并努力达到李教授设定的期望。在他们的会面中，李教授使用各种手段向张施压，要求他更加努力地工作，甚至使用诸如称他的工作“令人失望”和“低于平均水平”之类的情绪化语言。其他教职员工出席了会议，但不愿介入，因为在中国，上级强势发言并向下属施加压力被认为是正常的。然而，这种情况引发了伦理问题，让一些教职员工对李教授对待张的方式感到苦涩。,"Actor of the Norm:

Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a newspaper office in China, a senior writer, 张明, is pushing a junior reporter, 小红, to improve her reporting skills. 张明 is known for his intensity and emotional outbursts, especially towards junior members of his team. 小红, who is still new to the industry, is struggling to meet the expectations of her mentor. However, instead of becoming discouraged, she has decided to take his criticism constructively and is striving to improve her skills by working long hours and researching more deeply. Despite the intensity of the situation, the two colleagues maintain a respectful and professional demeanor towards each other, as is expected in Chinese society.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在中国的一家报社，资深作家张明正在督促初级记者小红提高她的报道技巧。张明以他的强烈和情绪爆发而闻名，尤其是对他的团队的初级成员。初入职场的小红，为了不辜负导师的期望而苦苦挣扎。然而，她没有气馁，而是决定建设性地接受他的批评，并通过长时间工作和更深入的研究来努力提高自己的技能。尽管形势严峻，两位同事仍保持着相互尊重和专业的态度，这符合中国社会的预期。,"Actor of the Norm:

Ms. Li, on the other hand, is new to the job and has not yet experienced Mr. Wang's intense approach. She is feeling overwhelmed by the situation and is struggling to cope with the pressure. Despite the stress and anxiety, Ms. Li remains professional and tries her best to handle the situation, hoping to gain Mr. Wang's approval and avoid any criticism from her higher-up.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在北京一家五星级酒店，经理王先生在繁忙的贵宾入住期间给前台服务员李小姐施加了巨大的压力。王先生以强硬的管理风格着称，在与团队沟通时偶尔会提高嗓门。而李女士是初入职场，还没有体验过王先生的火爆。她对这种情况感到不知所措，并且正在努力应对压力。尽管压力和焦虑，李女士仍保持专业，尽力处理此事，希望得到王先生的认可，避免受到上级的批评。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: A supervisor named Li is working in a factory overseeing the production of electronic goods. The factory is entirely dependent on meeting its daily production quotas to receive a large government contract. Li knows that the workers often do not meet their targets due to lack of motivation or being distracted. He decides to create an intense environment by shouting at his employees, setting high targets to pressure them into working harder. One of the workers, a young man named Zhang, feels overwhelmed and asks for help from his supervisor on how to meet the targets. Li, realizing that Zhang needs encouragement, uses a different approach by creating a positive working environment, praising Zhang's efforts and offering guidance to help him meet his targets.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：一位名叫李的主管在一家工厂工作，负责监督电子产品的生产。该工厂完全依赖满足其日常生产配额来获得政府的大额合同。李知道，由于缺乏动力或分心，工人们经常无法完成目标。他决定通过对员工大喊大叫来营造紧张的环境，设定高目标以迫使他们更加努力地工作。其中一名工人，名叫张的年轻人感到不知所措，并向他的主管寻求如何实现目标的帮助。意识到张需要鼓励，李采取了不同的方法，创造了积极的工作环境，称赞张的努力并提供指导以帮助他实现目标。,"Actor of the Norm:

Norm: In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, deliberate emotionalization is normal while criticizing, for example by creating an intense environment or giving pressure to a lower status colleague ,"Situation: In a government meeting, a high-ranking official named Mr. Zhang is leading a discussion with his subordinate, Ms. Li. As the discussion gets heated, Mr. Zhang deliberately raises his voice and creates a tense environment to pressure Ms. Li to improve her understanding of the topic. Despite Ms. Li being a junior staff in the office, it is totally acceptable in Chinese culture for someone in Mr. Zhang's position to use deliberate emotionalization while criticizing a subordinate's work. In fact, it is believed to be a way to show care and concern for the subordinate's professional development.",规范：在职场高低不同的情况下，对于较低职位的员工进行批评时，故意情绪化是正常的行为，比如制造紧张的氛围或给低级别同事施加压力。,情境：在一次政府会议上，一位名叫张先生的高级官员正在与他的下属李女士进行讨论。随着讨论的升温，张老师故意提高音量，制造紧张的气氛，迫使李女士提高对话题的理解。尽管李女士是办公室的基层员工，但在中国文化中，像张先生这样的人在批评下属的工作时故意情绪化是完全可以接受的。事实上，这被认为是表达对下属职业发展的关心和关心的一种方式。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: It is not customary to criticize or openly express disapproval of someone you do not know well, especially in public. However, this does not mean that criticism is never expressed in Chinese culture. It is more common to express criticism indirectly or through subtle hints, rather than directly confronting someone.,"Situation: A presenter named Zhang is conducting a business conference, showcasing a new product of his company. There is an attendee, a young businessman named Michael, who looks uninterested and is continuously checking his phone during the presentation. The presenter notices Michael's behavior and feels disrespected, but due to the social norm, he does not confront him directly. Instead, Zhang gives subtle hints throughout the presentation, trying to capture Michael's attention without being too direct. However, Michael still looks disinterested, not realizing that his behavior is being noticed and criticized indirectly by the presenter.",规范：在中国社会习惯上，对于不熟悉的人不习惯批评或公开表达不满，特别是在公共场合。但这并不意味着批评在中国文化中从不表达。通常更常用的是通过间接或微妙的暗示来表达批评，而不是直接面对某人。,情境：一位名叫张的主持人正在召开一个商务会议，展示他公司的一种新产品。有一位与会者，一位名叫迈克尔的年轻商人，他看起来不感兴趣，并且在演示过程中一直在查看他的手机。主持人注意到迈克尔的行为并感到不受尊重，但由于社会规范，他没有直接面对他。相反，张在整个演示过程中给出了微妙的暗示，试图在不太直接的情况下吸引迈克尔的注意力。然而，迈克尔仍然一副漠不关心的样子，没有意识到他的行为正在被主持人间接地注意到和批评。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: It is not customary to criticize or openly express disapproval of someone you do not know well, especially in public. However, this does not mean that criticism is never expressed in Chinese culture. It is more common to express criticism indirectly or through subtle hints, rather than directly confronting someone.,"Situation: At a family dinner, two distant relatives, Zhang and Li, meet for the first time in years. Zhang is known to have different beliefs and opinions from the rest of the family. During the dinner, Li makes a controversial statement about a recent political issue. Zhang disagrees but instead of directly confronting him, he subtly hints at his disagreement by mentioning a different perspective on the same issue. Li picks up on the hint and they engage in a respectful conversation, exchanging different opinions and ideas. This indirect way of expressing disagreement demonstrates how Chinese culture values avoiding conflict and maintaining harmony, even in heated discussions.",规范：在中国社会习惯上，对于不熟悉的人不习惯批评或公开表达不满，特别是在公共场合。但这并不意味着批评在中国文化中从不表达。通常更常用的是通过间接或微妙的暗示来表达批评，而不是直接面对某人。,情境：在一次家庭晚宴上，张和李这两个远房亲戚多年来第一次见面。众所周知，张与其他家庭成员有着不同的信仰和观点。在晚宴期间，李就最近的政治问题发表了有争议的声明。张不同意，但他没有直接面对他，而是通过提及对同一问题的不同观点来巧妙地暗示他的不同意见。李明白了这一点，他们进行了恭敬的交谈，交换了不同的意见和想法。这种表达分歧的间接方式表明，即使在激烈的讨论中，中国文化也非常重视避免冲突和保持和谐。,"Actor of the Norm:

Xiaoming notices that Xiaohong is lifting weights incorrectly and tells him so in front of everyone at the gym. Xiaohong is embarrassed because he thought he was doing it the right way. In Chinese culture, public criticism is generally discouraged, especially in front of strangers, so Xiaohong will likely feel ashamed and resentful towards Xiaoming. However, Xiaoming may feel that he is helping his friend by correcting his technique and preventing injury. They will need to navigate this situation carefully to maintain their friendship and avoid causing unnecessary conflict.",规范：在中国社会习惯上，对于不熟悉的人不习惯批评或公开表达不满，特别是在公共场合。但这并不意味着批评在中国文化中从不表达。通常更常用的是通过间接或微妙的暗示来表达批评，而不是直接面对某人。,情境：两个健身伙伴小明和小红在一家中国健身房锻炼。小明发现小红举重不正确，当着健身房所有人的面告诉他。小红很尴尬，因为他认为自己这样做是对的。在中国文化中，一般不鼓励公开批评，尤其是在陌生人面前，所以小红很可能会对小明感到羞耻和怨恨。然而，小明可能会觉得他通过纠正他的技术和防止受伤是在帮助他的朋友。他们需要小心应对这种情况，以维持友谊并避免引起不必要的冲突。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Within a family, criticism may be seen as an act of tough love, intended to help the family member correct a mistake. Chinese culture places a high value on respecting authority and hierarchy within the family. Criticizing an elder or a person in a position of authority, such as a parent or grandparent, is considered disrespectful and may be met with disapproval.,"Situation: During a Chinese family reunion, a grandfather became upset with his son, Jack, for not offering drinks to the guests. Jack, who has always struggled with social anxiety, froze up due to the pressure and embarrassment of the situation. The grandfather, seeking to teach Jack a lesson, began criticizing Jack in a harsh manner in front of other family members. Jack's cousins, who have a closer relationship with Jack than they do with their grandfather, became very uncomfortable and struggled with how to navigate the situation.",规范：在家庭中，批评可能被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。,情境：在一次中国家庭聚会中，一位祖父对他的儿子杰克不高兴，因为他没有为客人提供饮料。一直与社交焦虑作斗争的杰克，因处境的压力和尴尬而僵住了。祖父想给杰克一个教训，开始在其他家庭成员面前严厉批评杰克。杰克的堂兄弟们与杰克的关系比他们与祖父的关系更密切，他们变得非常不安，并为如何应对这种情况而苦苦挣扎。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Within a family, criticism may be seen as an act of tough love, intended to help the family member correct a mistake. Chinese culture places a high value on respecting authority and hierarchy within the family. Criticizing an elder or a person in a position of authority, such as a parent or grandparent, is considered disrespectful and may be met with disapproval.,"Situation: A Chinese grandmother, 吴奶奶, catches her granddaughter, 美莲, wearing revealing clothing to a family gathering. 吴奶奶 believes that it is inappropriate for a woman, especially one in younger generations, to wear revealing clothes in public. She takes a moment to explain her thoughts and tell 美莲 why her clothing choice doesn't fit the family's values. She hopes that her granddaughter will understand her perspective on Chinese culture and how important it is to respect family traditions. Even when there is a generation gap, 吴奶奶 wanted to make 美莲 realize how important it is to dress in accordance with both Chinese values and previous family traditions.",规范：在家庭中，批评可能被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。,情境：一位中国祖母吴奶奶发现她的孙女美莲穿着暴露的衣服参加家庭聚会。吴奶奶认为女性，尤其是年轻一代的女性，在公共场合穿着暴露是不合适的。她花点时间解释了自己的想法，并告诉美莲为什么她的服装选择不符合这个家庭的价值观。她希望孙女能理解她对中国文化的看法，以及尊重家庭传统的重要性。即使存在代沟，吴奶奶也想让美莲意识到穿着既符合中国价值观又符合以前的家庭传统是多么重要。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Within a family, criticism may be seen as an act of tough love, intended to help the family member correct a mistake. Chinese culture places a high value on respecting authority and hierarchy within the family. Criticizing an elder or a person in a position of authority, such as a parent or grandparent, is considered disrespectful and may be met with disapproval.,"Situation: A Chinese grandfather, who holds a high position in the family, demands his granddaughter to marry into a wealthy family to secure the family’s social status, despite the granddaughter’s objections. The granddaughter believes in following her own heart and is pursuing her passion in music. However, the grandfather sees this as a waste of time and talent. Seeing her granddaughter’s persistence, the mother tries to intervene and support her daughter’s dreams, but the grandfather sees it as a form of disrespect towards his authority and tradition. The situation becomes tense and the family must navigate the thin line between respecting authority and supporting individual aspirations.",规范：在家庭中，批评可能被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。,情境：一位身居高位的中国祖父不顾孙女的反对，要求孙女嫁入豪门以保证家庭的社会地位。孙女相信跟随自己的心，并追求她对音乐的热情。然而，祖父认为这是浪费时间和才华。看到孙女的坚持，母亲试图干预和支持女儿的梦想，但祖父认为这是对他的权威和传统的不尊重。局势变得紧张，家庭必须在尊重权威和支持个人愿望之间徘徊。,"Actor of the Norm:

This criticism did not sit well with 大山, who felt humiliated in front of his subordinates. column1: Norm: Within a family, criticism may be seen as an act of tough love, intended to help the family member correct a mistake. Chinese culture places a high value on respecting authority and hierarchy within the family. Criticizing an elder or a person in a position of authority, such as a parent or grandparent, is considered disrespectful and may be met with disapproval.,"Situation: During a family reunion, Grandma Wang, the respected matriarch of the family, offers critiques on how each family member can improve their life. She emphasizes that her comments are out of love and concern and that her intention is to help them improve. Since everyone in the family greatly respects and values Grandma Wang's thoughts and opinions, each family member carefully listens to her advice and takes notes to implement her suggestions. However, one family member, Cousin Zhang, is visibly agitated by Grandma's comments, as they perceive it as a direct attack on their career, which they consider as their sole identity. Despite this, Cousin Zhang ultimately acknowledges that Grandma's comments come from a place of love, and they take steps to improve their work-life balance.",规范：在家庭中，批评可能被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。,情境：在一次家庭团聚中，受人尊敬的一家之主王奶奶就如何改善每个家庭成员的生活发表了评论。她强调，她的评论是出于爱和关心，她的目的是帮助他们改进。由于家里的每个人都非常尊重和重视王奶奶的想法和意见，每个家庭成员都认真听取她的建议并记下来执行她的建议。然而，一位家庭成员，张表哥，显然对奶奶的评论感到不安，因为他们认为这是对他们职业生涯的直接攻击，他们认为职业生涯是他们唯一的身份。尽管如此，张表哥最终还是承认了奶奶的这番话是出于爱，他们采取措施改善工作与生活的平衡。,"Actor of the Norm:
王奶奶: elder, advocate of criticism as tough love
(王奶奶： 在家庭中，批评可能会被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。): Adhered

column1: Norm: Within a family, criticism may be seen as an act of tough love, intended to help the family member correct a mistake. Chinese culture places a high value on respecting authority and hierarchy within the family. Criticizing an elder or a person in a position of authority, such as a parent or grandparent, is considered disrespectful and may be met with disapproval.,"Situation: A father named Zhang Wei advises his son not to marry his girlfriend, Li Li, as he thinks their relationship won't work out in the long run. Li Li, who is also present at the conversation, speaks up and disagrees with Zhang Wei's opinion. As the argument between father and girlfriend becomes more heated, Zhang Wei's father, the grandparent of the young man, intervenes and scolds Zhang Wei for criticizing Li Li, who he views as a member of the family now. The grandparent reminds Zhang Wei that he should show respect towards his mother and father, but to also be mindful of respecting his girlfriend's opinions as she is now becoming a part of the family.",规范：在家庭中，批评可能被看作是一种严厉爱的行为，旨在帮助家庭成员改正错误。中国文化非常重视尊重家庭内部的权威和等级。批评长辈或担任权威职位的人，如父母或祖父母，被认为是不尊重的，可能会遭到反感。,情境：父亲张伟劝儿子不要和女友丽丽结婚，因为他认为他们的关系不会长久。在场的李莉也站出来表示不同意张伟的意见。父亲与女友的争吵愈演愈烈，小伙子的祖父母张伟的父亲出面干预，责骂张伟批评李丽，他现在把李丽当成家里的一员。爷爷奶奶提醒张伟，要尊重爸爸妈妈，但也要注意尊重女朋友的意见，因为她现在已经是家庭的一份子了。,"Actor of the Norm:

Norm: Most criticism between romantic partners are small arguments with small fighting but serve to improve the relationship between the partners. Partners use direct or impolite language between each other, but usually have the aim of caring for the other one. The male usually listens more and cares more for the female. Females usually cry or wait for apologies.,"Situation: A Chinese couple, Lily and Wei, are having a romantic dinner in a popular restaurant in Beijing. They both had a long day at work and are discussing their day. Wei feels proud of himself for completing many tasks, but Lily feels like he is not listening or taking her opinions seriously. Wei becomes upset and starts using direct language to criticize Lily's emotional reactions. Lily starts to cry, and other diners start to notice the situation. However, Wei recognizes his mistake and apologizes to Lily immediately, showing that he cares for her feelings. The other diners nod their approval, knowing that such arguments happen often in relationships, and it is a way for couples to improve their understanding and care for each other.",规范：大多数恋爱情侣之间的批评都是小的争吵，但是可以帮助恋人之间的关系得到改善。伴侣之间可能用直接或者不礼貌的语言，但通常是出于关心对方的目的。男性通常更倾听关心女性，女性通常哭泣或者等待道歉。,情境：一对中国夫妇，莉莉和魏，正在北京一家受欢迎的餐厅享用浪漫晚餐。他们都度过了漫长的一天，正在讨论他们的一天。伟为自己完成了许多任务而感到自豪，但莉莉却觉得他没有听取或认真对待她的意见。薇变得不高兴，开始用直接的语言批评莉莉的情绪反应。莉莉开始哭泣，其他食客开始注意到这一情况。伟却认错，立即向莉莉道歉，表示很在意她的感受。其他食客点头赞同，知道这样的争吵在感情中经常发生，也是夫妻间增进理解和关心的一种方式。,"Actor of the Norm:

Mei begins to cry, and Ming realizes that he needs to apologize and compromise for the sake of their relationship. He agrees to watch the romantic comedy, even though he's not a fan, and Mei feels heard and cared for by Ming's willingness to make the sacrifice.",规范：大多数恋爱情侣之间的批评都是小的争吵，但是可以帮助恋人之间的关系得到改善。伴侣之间可能用直接或者不礼貌的语言，但通常是出于关心对方的目的。男性通常更倾听关心女性，女性通常哭泣或者等待道歉。,情境：在上海的一家电影院里，一对夫妇，明和梅，正在为看哪部电影争论不休。明想看一部充满动作的超级英雄电影，而美想看一部爱情喜剧。争论愈演愈烈，梅指责明麻木自私，而明则指责梅过于情绪化和戏剧化。美开始哭泣，明意识到为了他们的关系，他需要道歉和妥协。他同意看这部浪漫喜剧，尽管他不是粉丝，明愿意做出牺牲，美感到被倾听和关心。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Most criticism between romantic partners are small arguments with small fighting but serve to improve the relationship between the partners. Partners use direct or impolite language between each other, but usually have the aim of caring for the other one. The male usually listens more and cares more for the female. Females usually cry or wait for apologies.,"Situation: In a coffee shop in Shanghai, a young couple, Li and Bei, are chatting about their future relationship. Li expresses concerns about Bei’s flirtatious behavior and suspects that she might be cheating on him. Bei feels hurt and defensive, arguing back that Li is too controlling and has a problem with trust. They continue to argue and raise their voices, causing some other customers to stare at them. However, at the end of their argument, Li apologizes for losing his temper, takes Bei’s hand and tells her that he cares for her and wants to work things out. Bei, feeling emotional, fights back tears, and accepts his apology, feeling relieved that he still loves her.",规范：大多数恋爱情侣之间的批评都是小的争吵，但是可以帮助恋人之间的关系得到改善。伴侣之间可能用直接或者不礼貌的语言，但通常是出于关心对方的目的。男性通常更倾听关心女性，女性通常哭泣或者等待道歉。,情境：在上海的一家咖啡店里，一对年轻夫妇李和北正在谈论他们未来的恋爱关系。李对贝的调情行为表示担忧，并怀疑她可能在欺骗他。北感到受伤和防御，反驳说李太控制欲强，信任有问题。他们继续争吵并提高声音，导致其他一些顾客盯着他们看。然而，在争吵结束时，李为自己发脾气道歉，拉着北的手告诉她，他很关心她，想把事情解决。贝情绪激动，忍住眼泪，接受了他的道歉，为他仍然爱她而松了一口气。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Direct Criticism In a professional setting with higher status speaking to lower status, it is permitted to use direct language, a strong tone of voice, and display emotions when criticizing  one's behavior, ideas, and work.,"Situation: A senior manager in a Chinese tech company is having a meeting with his team of subordinate employees. During the meeting, he notices that one of the team members, Lin, has not been meeting the project deadlines and has been showing lackluster performance. The manager decides to speak to Lin directly and use a strong tone of voice to criticize his work. However, the manager is also mindful of not causing any loss of face for Lin and makes sure to provide constructive feedback that will help Lin improve his performance. As a result, Lin takes the feedback positively and is motivated to improve his work.","规范：直接批评

在职场中，当地位较高者对地位较低者进行批评时，可以使用直接的语言、强烈的语调并传达情感，评价其行为、想法和工作。",情境：一家中国科技公司的高级经理正在与他的下属团队开会。在会议期间，他注意到其中一名团队成员 Lin 没有按时完成项目，并且一直表现不佳。经理决定直接找林说话，用强硬的语气批评他的工作。然而，经理也注意不要让林失去任何面子，并确保提供建设性的反馈，以帮助林改善他的表现。因此，Lin 积极接受反馈并积极改进他的工作。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with a lower status person speaking to a higher status person, it is preferred to use indirect, subtle language when criticizing one's behavior, ideas, and work while being respectful.,"Situation: In a law firm in China, an associate named Zhang Wei is giving feedback to a senior partner, Mr. Li. Mr. Li is a well-respected, experienced lawyer in the firm who has a reputation for being harsh on younger associates. Zhang Wei, who is new to the firm, needs to provide Mr. Li with feedback on a case. Zhang Wei has studied Mr. Li's previous work and has noticed areas where he could improve. However, he is hesitant to come across as disrespectful or challenge Mr. Li's authority. Instead, Zhang Wei uses indirect language such as “Perhaps we could consider adding more evidence to strengthen our argument” to provide constructive critique while still showing respect to his senior partner.",规范：在一个职场环境中，低等级的人当要批评上级的行为、想法或者工作时，最好使用间接、含蓄的语言表达，并保持尊重。,情境：在中国的一家律师事务所，张伟律师正在向高级合伙人李律师反馈意见。李律师是本所德高望重、经验丰富的律师，以对年轻同事苛刻着称。新入所的张伟需要向李总反馈一个案例。张伟研究了李先生以前的工作，并注意到了他可以改进的地方。不过，他不愿给人留下不尊重或挑战李先生权威的印象。相反，张伟使用“也许我们可以考虑增加更多证据来加强我们的论点”等间接语言来提供建设性的批评，同时仍然尊重他的高级合伙人。,"Actor of the Norm:

Jie's work on the project has been subpar, and Mr. Zhang believes that Jie needs to improve his writing skills. However, according to the norm, Mr. Zhang should not directly criticize Jie. Instead, he would need to use ambiguous and subtle language to convey his message to Jie. Mr. Zhang needs to be careful to use polite, indirect language to avoid offending Jie and to ensure that their working relationship remains intact.",规范：在同行之间的职业场合中，使用间接、微妙的语言和语调对他人的行为、想法和工作进行批评是必须的。,情境：在项目评审会上，主管张先生正在评估他的员工杰的绩效。杰在该项目上的工作表现不佳，张先生认为杰需要提高写作水平。但是，按照惯例，张先生不应该直接批评杰。相反，他需要使用模棱两可的微妙语言来向杰传达他的信息。张先生需要小心使用礼貌、间接的语言，以免冒犯杰，并确保他们的工作关系保持完整。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In a professional setting with peer speaking to peer, it is obligatory to criticize one's behavior, ideas, and work using indirect, subtle language and tone.,"Situation: During the workshop, the team leader, Min, presents her idea to the participants. One of the participants, a younger colleague named Xiao, disagrees with Min's suggestion and openly criticizes her idea in front of everyone using direct language and tone. The rest of the participants become uncomfortable with the situation as it violates the norm of indirectness in criticizing others. The team leader tries to maintain the harmony by redirecting the conversation and asking others to share their thoughts on the matter. Later, during a break, Xiao apologizes to Min and explains that he did not mean to come across as disrespectful, but wanted to contribute to the discussion. Min accepts his apology and thanks him for his input, using indirect language to show her appreciation.",规范：在同行之间的职业场合中，使用间接、微妙的语言和语调对他人的行为、想法和工作进行批评是必须的。,情境：在工作坊期间，团队负责人 Min 向参与者展示了她的想法。其中一名参与者，一位名叫肖的年轻同事不同意敏的建议，并在所有人面前用直接的语言和语气公开批评她的想法。其他参与者对这种情况感到不舒服，因为它违反了批评他人的间接规范。团队负责人试图通过重新引导对话并要求其他人分享他们对此事的看法来保持和谐。后来，在休息期间，肖向敏道歉并解释说他并不是要给人留下不尊重的印象，而是想为讨论做出贡献。敏接受了他的道歉并感谢他的意见，使用间接语言表达她的感激之情。,"Actor of the Norm:

Following the norms of Chinese business culture, Mr. Zhang criticizes Mark's ideas using indirect, subtle language and tone, rather than direct confrontation. The conversation continues with both sides expressing their views respectfully and professionally. At the end of the discussion, they exchange business cards and discuss potential collaborations.",规范：在同行之间的职业场合中，使用间接、微妙的语言和语调对他人的行为、想法和工作进行批评是必须的。,情境：在上海的一次社交活动中，一群中国企业高管正在讨论各自领域的行业趋势和最佳实践。美国演讲嘉宾马克也加入了他们的行列，他介绍了他公司的创新营销方法。其中一位中国高管张先生不同意马克的做法，并希望在集团面前挑战它。按照中国商业文化的规范，张先生用间接、微妙的语言和语气批评马克的想法，而不是直接对抗。对话继续进行，双方恭敬而专业地表达了各自的观点。在讨论结束时，他们交换名片并讨论潜在的合作。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Before giving criticism, it is important to acknowledge the positive aspects of the person or their work. This helps to soften the impact of the criticism and shows that the person is valued. For example "你在某些方面做得非常好，但我认为还有一些方面需要改进。","Situation: The manager, Mr. Li, is providing feedback to his employee, Li Na, in their office in China. Li Na has been working hard lately, but Mr. Li has noticed some mistakes in her most recent work. He knows that providing constructive criticism is important for Li Na's growth, so he starts by acknowledging the positive aspects of her work. He says, ""Li Na, 你在很多方面都表现得非常优秀，特别是在完成任务的时候非常认真。但是，我注意到你最近的工作中有一些小错误。"" By acknowledging Li Na's strengths first, Mr. Li hopes to soften the impact of his criticism and show Li Na that she is valued as an employee.","规范：在提出批评意见之前，重要的是先承认这个人或他们的工作的积极方面。这有助于减轻批评的影响并表明这个人受到重视。例如：""你在某些方面做得非常好，但我认为还有一些方面需要改进。""",情境：中国的办公室内，经理李先生正在给他的员工李娜提供反馈意见。李娜最近一直在努力工作，但李先生注意到她最近的工作中有些错误。他知道提供建设性的批评对李娜的成长很重要，因此他开始承认她工作的积极方面。他说：“李娜，你在很多方面都表现得非常优秀，特别是在完成任务的时候非常认真。但是，我注意到你最近的工作中有一些小错误。” 通过先承认李娜的优点，李先生希望缓和批评的影响，并表达李娜的重要性作为一名员工。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: Before giving criticism, it is important to acknowledge the positive aspects of the person or their work. This helps to soften the impact of the criticism and shows that the person is valued. For example "你在某些方面做得非常好，但我认为还有一些方面需要改进。","Situation: At a music academy in China, a vocal coach is giving feedback to a student, Ling, who is struggling with her high notes. The coach, Mr. Zhang, starts the conversation by praising her natural tone and dedicated practice ethic. He then points out that he thinks there's room for improvement on some difficult high notes. Ling nods, taking notes and agreeing, and the coach goes on to demonstrate the correct technique. Afterwards, Ling feels motivated by the positive feedback and better understands where she can improve. The atmosphere in the academy is one of support and constructive criticism, a typical way of giving feedback in Chinese culture.","规范：在提出批评意见之前，重要的是先承认这个人或他们的工作的积极方面。这有助于减轻批评的影响并表明这个人受到重视。例如：""你在某些方面做得非常好，但我认为还有一些方面需要改进。""",情境：在中国的一所音乐学院，一名声乐教练正在向正在努力提高高音的学生 Ling 提供反馈。教练张先生以赞扬她自然的语气和敬业的职业道德开始了谈话。然后他指出，他认为在一些困难的高音上还有改进的余地。 Ling 点点头，做笔记并表示同意，教练继续演示正确的技巧。之后，Ling 对积极的反馈感到有动力，并且更好地了解自己可以改进的地方。学院的氛围是一种支持和建设性批评的氛围，这是中国文化中典型的反馈方式。,"Actor of the Norm:

Norm: In Chinese culture, criticism is often framed as a suggestion rather than a direct criticism. This helps to avoid hurting the person's feelings and allows them to save face. For example, "我有一些建议，如果你有兴趣可以听听。","Situation: A group of Chinese colleagues are in a business meeting discussing a new project. The team leader, Ming, presents his idea and the group is hesitant to give feedback. One colleague, Lan, notices some flaws in the idea but is afraid to criticize directly and hurt Ming's face. Instead, Lan calmly says, ""Ming, I have a few suggestions that could enhance the idea. Would you be interested in hearing them?"" Ming agrees, and Lan proceeds to address the issues in a polite and diplomatic manner, utilizing the cultural norm of framing criticism as a suggestion to convey her concerns without causing offense.",规范：在中国文化中，批评通常以建议的形式呈现，而不是直接批评。这有助于避免伤害到他人的感情，使他们能够保全自尊。例如，“我有一些建议，如果你有兴趣可以听听。”,情境：一群中国同事正在开会讨论一个新项目。团队负责人 Ming 提出了他的想法，而该团队却犹豫不决是否要提供反馈。一位名叫兰的同事注意到这个想法存在一些缺陷，但不敢直接批评并伤害明的面子。相反，兰平静地说：“明，我有一些建议可以加强这个想法。你有兴趣听听吗？” Ming 表示同意，Lan 开始以礼貌和外交的方式处理这些问题，利用提出批评的文化规范作为建议来表达她的担忧而不会引起冒犯。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, criticism is often framed as a suggestion rather than a direct criticism. This helps to avoid hurting the person's feelings and allows them to save face. For example, "我有一些建议，如果你有兴趣可以听听。","Situation: During a charity organization meeting in China, a group of volunteers are discussing ways to improve their outreach efforts. Instead, Li starts by saying “我有一些建议，如果你们有兴趣可以听听。” Li then suggests a new approach that he thinks would be more helpful in reaching their goals. The group listens attentively and decides to implement Li’s suggestions, appreciating the constructive feedback.",规范：在中国文化中，批评通常以建议的形式呈现，而不是直接批评。这有助于避免伤害到他人的感情，使他们能够保全自尊。例如，“我有一些建议，如果你有兴趣可以听听。”,情境：在中国的一次慈善组织会议上，一群志愿者正在讨论如何改进他们的外展工作。其中一名志愿者 Li 不同意当前的策略，并认为采用不同的方法会更有效。然而，李不想直接批评目前的努力，以免伤害任何人的感情或引起冲突。相反，李首先说“我有一些建议，如果你们有兴趣可以听。”然后李提出了一种他认为更有助于实现目标的新方法。该小组认真倾听并决定实施李的建议，感谢建设性的反馈。,"Actor of the Norm:

She makes it clear that she appreciates Xiao Ming's potential and encourages him to improve his work ethic to fulfill his potential.",规范：当批评他人时，重要的是避免人身攻击，集中于需要改进的行为或行动。人身攻击可能被视为不尊重并加剧局面。例如，“我不是在批评你的人品，而是在谈论你的行为。”,情境：王老师在中国一所高中的小组项目结束后向她的学生提供反馈。一位名叫小明的学生经常错过最后期限，贡献不大，并且在小组会议上分心。王老师知道批评小明的性格不会有建设性或帮助，所以她决定只关注学生的行为举止。她明确表示，她欣赏小明的潜力，并鼓励他提高职业道德以发挥自己的潜力。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to offer a solution or suggestion when criticizing someone. This shows that the criticism is intended to be constructive and helpful. For example, “我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,"Situation: In a business meeting, a team of Chinese engineers is discussing a project with their American counterparts. During the discussion, a Chinese engineer, Xiaowen, criticizes the work done by the American team. Xiaowen points out several flaws in the American team's plan without providing any alternative solutions. The American team becomes defensive and starts to argue back, causing the meeting to become tense. The Chinese team leader, Jiajia, steps in and reminds Xiaowen of the cultural norm of offering a solution when criticizing someone. Jiajia suggests that Xiaowen could provide alternative solutions to the problems she has identified. Xiaowen takes the advice and offers several suggestions on how to improve the American team's plan. As a result, the meeting becomes more productive and respectful towards each other's opinions.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,情境：在一次商务会议上，一组中国工程师正在与他们的美国同行讨论一个项目。在讨论中，中国工程师小文批评了美国团队所做的工作。小文指出了美国队计划中的几个缺陷，但没有提供任何替代方案。美国队开始防守并开始反驳，导致会议变得紧张。中国团队负责人佳佳介入并提醒小文批评某人时提供解决方案的文化规范。佳佳建议小文可以针对她发现的问题提供替代解决方案。小文采纳了建议，就如何完善美国队的计划提出了几点建议。结果，会议变得更有成效，也更加尊重彼此的意见。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to offer a solution or suggestion when criticizing someone. This shows that the criticism is intended to be constructive and helpful. For example, “我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,"Situation: At a parent-teacher conference in a Chinese primary school, a group of parents are giving feedback to their children's Mandarin teacher, Ms. Zhang, for their kids' poor pronunciation. As a Chinese culture norm, the parents show respect by thanking and acknowledging the teacher’s expertise before any criticism. They start by praising the teacher’s skills as an experienced Mandarin teacher, but then, they suggest that their children might benefit from additional practice or different instructional methods. Everyone at the meeting ensure that they use respectful language, and maintain a calm and polite demeanor to convey their feedback, again to keep the criticism constructive and helpful. Ms. Zhang takes their feedback professionally and offers new strategies to the parents to help their children improve their Mandarin skills.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,情境：在一所华小的家长会上，一群家长向他们孩子的国语老师张老师反馈他们孩子的发音不好。作为中国文化的规范，父母在批评之前先感谢和承认老师的专业知识，以表示尊重。他们首先称赞这位老师作为经验丰富的普通话老师的技能，然后他们建议他们的孩子可能会从额外的练习或不同的教学方法中受益。会议中的每个人都确保他们使用尊重的语言，并保持冷静和礼貌的举止来传达他们的反馈，再次保持批评的建设性和帮助性。张老师专业地听取他们的反馈，并为家长提供新的策略来帮助他们的孩子提高普通话水平。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to offer a solution or suggestion when criticizing someone. This shows that the criticism is intended to be constructive and helpful. For example, “我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,"Situation: In a Chinese literature classroom, Ms. Zhang is giving feedback on a student’s essay. However, the student, Wei, made several mistakes in grammar and sentence structure. Ms. Zhang wants to offer constructive criticism, but she is trying to balance her feedback with Wei’s feelings. She decides to start by praising Wei's strong understanding of the text and then suggests a few alternatives to the problem areas in the essay. She explains that “我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。” Wei nods in agreement, happy to have his essay improved with helpful feedback. And, Ms. Zhang feels satisfied that she was able to provide constructive criticism without hurting Wei's feelings.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,情境：在国文课上，张老师正在对学生的作文进行点评。然而，魏同学在语法和句子结构上犯了几个错误。张女士想提出建设性的批评意见，但她正在努力平衡自己的反馈与魏某的感受。她决定首先表扬魏对文本的深刻理解，然后针对文章中的问题领域提出一些替代方案。她解释说，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”魏点头表示同意，很高兴他的文章得到了改进，并得到了有用的反馈。而且，张女士对自己能够在不伤害魏某感情的情况下提供建设性批评感到满意。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to offer a solution or suggestion when criticizing someone. This shows that the criticism is intended to be constructive and helpful. For example, “我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,"Situation: During a break, Chinese colleagues are discussing their recent project. One of the colleagues, 丽婷, suggests that the approach taken by another colleague, 小明, is not effective. She points out the flaws in his approach but also provides some suggestions to make it better like “我认为我们可以考虑增加更多数据分析，或者采用更先进的技术，这样就可以更快地获得结果。” The conversation continues, with the other colleagues offering their input and discussing solutions to make the project more successful. Despite the criticism, everyone takes it constructively and strives to improve the project together. This showcases the importance of constructive feedback in Chinese culture, which helps individuals and teams to grow and improve.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,情境：在休息时间，中国的同事们在讨论他们最近的项目。其中一个同事丽婷建议，另一位同事小明所采取的方法不够有效。她指出了他的方法存在的缺陷，同时提出一些建议来改进：“我认为我们可以考虑增加更多数据分析，或者采用更先进的技术，这样就可以更快地获得结果。”尽管存在批评，但所有人都将其建设性看待，并努力一起改进项目。这展示了建设性反馈在中国文化中的重要性，它有助于个人和团队的成长和改进。,"Actor of the Norm:

One of the neighbors, Mr. Li, points out the poor maintenance of the community garden and suggests that the responsible party should be held accountable. However, his tone comes off as overly critical and condescending to the rest of the group. To adhere to the social norm of offering a solution or suggestion, another neighbor, Ms. Zhang, suggests that they should form a gardening committee and take turns to maintain the garden. She also offers to lead the committee as she has prior experience in gardening. This way, they can address the issue constructively and ensure that the community garden is well-maintained.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,情境：在一次社区聚会中，一群中国邻居正在讨论改善邻里关系的方法。邻居李先生指出社区花园维护不善，建议追究责任方责任。然而，他的语气给人的感觉是对其他人过于挑剔和居高临下。为了坚持提供解决方案或建议的社会规范，另一位邻居张女士建议他们成立一个园艺委员会，轮流维护花园。她还主动提出领导委员会，因为她之前有园艺方面的经验。这样，他们就可以建设性地解决问题，并确保社区花园得到良好维护。,"Actor of the Norm:

The group is feeling discouraged and frustrated, as they feel that Wei is not contributing to the discussion in a helpful way.

One of the group leaders, Xiao Mei, reminds Wei of the cultural norm in China to offer constructive solutions when criticizing others. She suggests that Wei reflect on his own ideas and see if there are ways to adjust them to better align with the overall goals and vision of the group.

Wei takes the suggestion to heart and begins to offer more specific critiques with potential solutions attached. The group feels more productive as a result, and they are able to make progress towards their goal of a cleaner community.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时，提供一些解决方案或建议是非常重要的。这样做可以表明批评是有建设性和帮助性的。例如，“我认为我们可以尝试另一种方法，这样可以更有效地解决这个问题。”,"情境：在志愿者小组会议上，成员们正在讨论如何改善他们的项目以清理当地环境。然而，一位姓魏的成员一直在批评别人的想法，却没有提出任何建设性的解决方案。该小组感到气馁和沮丧，因为他们觉得 Wei 没有以有益的方式参与讨论。
小组负责人之一肖梅提醒魏伟，中国的文化规范是在批评他人时提供建设性的解决方案。她建议 Wei 反思自己的想法，看看是否有办法调整它们，以更好地与团队的总体目标和愿景保持一致。
魏将这个建议牢记在心，并开始提供更具体的批评，并附上可能的解决方案。结果，该小组感觉更有效率，并且他们能够在实现更清洁社区的目标方面取得进展。","Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: When criticizing someone, it is important to show empathy and understand their perspective. This can help the person being criticized feel less attacked and more willing to listen to the criticism. For example, “我理解你的想法，但是我认为我们还是需要改进这个方面。”,"Situation: A customer service representative, 小张, is addressing a complaint from a customer named Mr. Smith. Mr. Smith had purchased a faulty product and when he had called the company, he was put on hold for a long time before he was able to speak with a representative. 小张 empathized with Mr. Smith's frustration, and praised him for his patience during the long waiting period. She explained that the company is experiencing a higher than usual number of calls and that they were working to resolve the issue as soon as possible. She then offered to send a replacement product to Mr. Smith and apologized for the inconvenience caused. Mr. Smith was pleased with how 小张 handled his complaint and thanked her for her understanding.",规范：当批评他人时，重要的是要表现出同情心，理解他们的观点。这可以帮助被批评的人感到不那么受到攻击，更愿意听取批评。例如，“我理解你的想法，但是我认为我们还是需要在这方面做出改进。”,情境：客户服务代表小张正在处理一位名叫史密斯先生的客户的投诉。史密斯先生购买了一个有缺陷的产品，当他打电话给公司时，他被搁置了很长时间才能与代表通话。小张感同身受史密斯先生的受挫，称赞他在漫长的等待期间耐心等待。她解释说，该公司接到的电话数量比平时多，他们正在努力尽快解决这个问题。然后，她主动提出将替换产品寄给史密斯先生，并对由此造成的不便表示歉意。史密斯先生对小张处理投诉的方式感到满意，并感谢她的理解。,"Actor of the Norm:

Knowing that Lily values her independence and personal space, he starts the conversation by empathizing with her and saying ""我理解你很重视个人隐私和自由，但我想让你知道，在我们的约会时，我希望我们能够更多地相互关注和陪伴。"" He then proceeds to express his feelings and asks for her perspective on the matter. By showing empathy, Wei allows Lily to feel comfortable and more open to the discussion, leading to a healthy and productive conversation.",规范：当批评他人时，重要的是要表现出同情心，理解他们的观点。这可以帮助被批评的人感到不那么受到攻击，更愿意听取批评。例如，“我理解你的想法，但是我认为我们还是需要在这方面做出改进。”,情境：莉莉和韦已经交往了两年。韦在约会期间，莉莉总是需要不停地看手机，这让他感到受伤。他决定在公园散步时提出这个话题。因为了解莉莉重视独立和个人空间，他开始倾听她的想法，说：“我理解你很重视个人隐私和自由，但我希望我们在约会时，能够更多地相互关注和陪伴。”随后，他表达了自己的感受，并询问了她的想法。通过表现出同情心，韦让莉莉感到舒服，并更加愿意开放地讨论这个话题，带来了健康和富有成效的交流。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to use polite language when criticizing someone, especially if the person is of a higher status. Polite language can show respect and soften the criticism. Verbal evidence: “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,"Situation: In a business meeting in China, a younger employee named Ming is attending a meeting with several senior executives, including his boss, Mr. Li. Mr. Li is presenting a new business proposal, but Ming thinks that the decision has some problems. Although Ming is worried about criticizing his boss, he decides to do so using polite language. He says, “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。” Hearing this, Mr. Li nods his head in agreement and asks Ming to share his thoughts. Ming proceeds to identify the issues he sees in the proposal, and the meeting continues with a productive discussion.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时使用有礼貌的语言非常重要，尤其是如果对方地位较高。有礼貌的语言可以展示尊重，并减轻批评的程度。口头证据：“请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,情境：在中国的一次商务会议上，一位名叫明的年轻员工正在与几位高级管理人员开会，其中包括他的老板李先生。李先生正在提出一项新的商业计划书，但明认为该决定存在一些问题。虽然明担心批评他的老板，但他还是决定用礼貌的语言来批评他。他说，“请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”听到这话，李先生点头同意并请明分享他的想法。 Ming 继续确定他在提案中看到的问题，会议继续进行富有成效的讨论。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to use polite language when criticizing someone, especially if the person is of a higher status. Verbal evidence: “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,"Situation: In a Chinese university, the business management professor, Mr. Li, gives his lecture on a new business strategy. After the lecture, Xiaoli, one of his students, approaches him and tells him that she disagrees with some of the points he made during the class. According to Chinese culture, it is customary to use polite language when giving feedback to a higher-status individual, so Xiaoli uses the phrase “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。” which means ""Please forgive my frankness, but I think there are some problems with this decision.” Mr. Li appreciates Xiaoli’s critique, and they engage in a respectful discussion about the topic, which highlights the importance of humility and mutual respect in Chinese culture.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时使用有礼貌的语言非常重要，尤其是如果对方地位较高。有礼貌的语言可以展示尊重，并减轻批评的程度。口头证据：“请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,情境：在一所中国大学里，商业管理教授李先生就一项新的商业战略发表演讲。讲座结束后，他的一名学生小丽走近他，告诉他她不同意他在课堂上提出的一些观点。按照中国文化，在给地位较高的人反馈时习惯使用礼貌用语，所以小丽使用了“请原谅我的直言，但认为我为这个决定有一些问题。”的意思是“请原谅我的问题。”坦率地说，但我认为这个决定存在一些问题。”李先生对小丽的批评表示赞赏，他们就这个话题进行了恭敬的讨论，这凸显了谦虚和相互尊重在中国文化中的重要性。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to use polite language when criticizing someone, especially if the person is of a higher status. Polite language can show respect and soften the criticism. Verbal evidence: “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,"Situation: An elderly citizen, Ms. Li, is expressing her disagreement with a new policy to a government official at the local Bureau of Civil Affairs. Ms. Li is concerned that the policy will negatively impact her community, and she wants to voice her concerns. However, the official she is speaking to is of a higher status and authority. Ms. Li remembers the social norm of using polite language when criticizing someone of higher status. She begins her statement with “请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。” The official looks impressed with her respectfulness and listens carefully to her concerns. Ms. Li successfully expresses her point of view while also showing respect to the government official, which is an important cultural value in China.",规范：在中国文化中，批评别人时使用有礼貌的语言非常重要，尤其是如果对方地位较高。有礼貌的语言可以展示尊重，并减轻批评的程度。口头证据：“请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”,情境：一位老人李女士向当地民政局的一位政府官员表达了她对一项新政策的反对意见。李女士担心该政策会对她的社区产生负面影响，她想表达自己的担忧。然而，她正在与之交谈的官员具有更高的地位和权威。李女士记得在批评地位较高的人时使用礼貌用语的社会规范。她以“请原谅我的直言，但我认为这个决定有一些问题。”开始她的陈述。这位官员看起来对她的尊重印象深刻，并仔细倾听她的担忧。李女士成功地表达了自己的观点，同时也表达了对政府官员的尊重，这在中国是一种重要的文化价值。,"Actor of the Norm:

column1: Norm: In Chinese culture, it is important to use polite language when criticizing someone, especially if the person is of a higher status. For example, “你的这个想法很好，但我认为我们可以尝试改进这个方面。”,"Situation: During a business meeting in China, executives from a tech company are discussing a proposal for their new product launch. One executive, Mr. Li, is presenting his ideas to the group but is met with some criticism from his colleagues. However, to adhere to the social norm, they acknowledge Mr. Li's excellent contributions in the past and highlight his excellent ideas throughout the presentation, balancing out their criticism with positive feedback. One colleague, in particular, points out how well Mr. Li's suggestions align with the project's objectives and praises his dedication towards the company's success. This approach helps Mr. Li take constructive criticism positively and feel less attacked, leading to a productive discussion that benefits the company.",规范：在批评别人时，重要的是要承认他们所做的好事情。这可以帮助平衡批评，并使被批评的人感觉不受攻击。例如，“你的这个想法很好，但我认为我们可以尝试改进这个方面。”,情境：在中国的一次商务会议上，一家科技公司的高管正在讨论一项新产品发布提案。一位名叫李书福的高管正在向团队介绍他的想法，但遭到了同事的一些批评。然而，为了遵守社会规范，他们承认李先生过去的卓越贡献，并在整个演讲中突出他的优秀想法，以积极反馈平衡他们的批评。一位同事特别指出了李先生的建议与项目目标的契合度，并称赞他为公司的成功所做的奉献。这种方法有助于李先生积极接受建设性的批评，减少受到攻击的感觉，从而进行富有成效的讨论，从而使公司受益。,"Actor of the Norm:
